title: Types of Decisions
content: Operational decisions fall into three categories: routine (follow established procedures), tactical (judgment within known parameters), and critical (immediate action with incomplete information). Each type requires a different approach. Applying a routine approach to a critical decision wastes time. Applying a critical approach to routine decisions wastes energy and creates fatigue.

mcq.question: A new alarm you've never seen activates. No procedure exists for this specific alarm. What type of decision is required?

options.C: Critical—this is novel and may require immediate action
options.D: No decision needed—wait for more information

mcq.explanation: This is tactical: novel situation but not necessarily immediate emergency. Apply judgment using general principles and known system behavior to determine appropriate response.

openQuestions: What percentage of your daily decisions are routine vs tactical vs critical?
How do you recognize when a situation has shifted from routine to tactical or critical?
